intro: Aegonychon thessalicum, commonly known as the Thessalian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, glandular leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
